intro: Stylidium longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive trigger mechanism that facilitates pollination. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces striking red or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Stylidium longifolium is a perennial herb that is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
